item.title: The UNIX `who` command
item.description: The who command While working on a completely different project, I started to ask myself how the who command was working under the hood. In the end, I thought it was a good topic for a blog post. Who is who Let’s start with the basics. the who command allows you to list the users currently logged on the system. For example, on my machine: $ who gauthier tty2 2020-08-30 15:06 (tty2) gauthier pts/1 2020-08-30 15:06 (tmux(1555).
